questions.question: My grandmother is eighty-five, but she ……………… still read and write without glasses. (Ability)
questions.description: We use can to express ability.

questions.question: …………….. I come with you?
questions.description: We use can to ask for permission.

questions.question: ………………. you help me with the housework, please? (Polite request)
questions.description: We use could in polite requests.

questions.question: There was a time when I ………….. stay up very late. (Past ability)
questions.description: We use could to talk about past ability.

questions.question: You …………….. not lose any more weight. You are already slim. (Necessity)
questions.description: We use need to show necessity.

questions.question: We …………… make the first move. (Prohibition)
questions.description: We use must not to prohibit.

questions.question: It is snowing outside so I …………… stay at home. (Intention)
questions.description: We use will to express our intentions.

questions.question: I ………………. get you a shawl from Kashmir. (Promise)
questions.description: We use will to make a promise.

questions.question: …………….. you mind if I borrowed your car? (Permission)
questions.description: We use would in expressions with mind.

questions.question: ……………. you take care of my dog for a day? (Polite request)
questions.description: We can use will in requests.

questions.question: Our country ………………. become a super power by  (possibility)
questions.description: We use may to indicate possibility.

questions.question: She …………… sell her home because she needs money. (weak possibility)
